summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel, notifying them that the first discovery production in the case against Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 490) has been loaded onto a drive and is ready for pickup. The email includes an attached discovery and disclosure letter.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding discovery production in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding discovery production in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Recipient of the email; the discovery envelope is labeled with his name for pickup.

connections.description: Both are recipients of the same legal correspondence regarding discovery in the Epstein case, suggesting they are part of the defense legal team.

events.title: Discovery Production Notification
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office notifies defense counsel that the first discovery production in the Epstein case (19 Cr. 490) has been loaded onto a drive and is ready for pickup.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 31, 2019, regarding the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein (docket number 19 Cr. 490).
The first discovery production by the Government in the Epstein case was completed and made available to the defense team.
The correspondence is from an Assistant United States Attorney to defense attorneys Marc Fernich, Martin Weinberg, and Michael Miller.
The discovery was provided on a physical drive, requiring pickup from the U.S. Attorney's office.
